subject: RE: [junit] Disabling Inherited Tests
msgSnippet: Move the setup tests to a separate subclass (so the base class has only the setup).  Is it really bad to test the setup whenever it gets invoked, though?
messageBody:
Move the setup tests to a separate subclass (so the base class has only
the setup). Is it really bad to test the setup whenever it gets
invoked, though?



..David..



From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Ole Ersoy
Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2007 9:45 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Disabling Inherited Tests



Hi,

I've created
a SetupTest class
that just performs setup,
but also tests the setup.

So when other test
classes inherit from it,
the inherited tests run
each time.

Anyone know if I can disable the inherited tests?

Thanks,
- Ole





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
